title: Loaded with trash talk and talent, the Patriots’ D-line might be the crew that wins Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots' defensive line, led by Milton Williams, dominated top offensive lines in playoff victories, including a win over Denver.
Christian Barmore and Khyiris Tonga have been vital for the Patriots, who allowed an average of just 8.7 points per game post-season.
The Patriots' D-line aims to disrupt Seahawks QB Sam Darnold in Super Bowl LX to secure another championship win.

title: Man pleads guilty to Snapchat hacking targeting Northeastern students
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Kyle Svara, 27, pleaded guilty to charges related to hacking Snapchat accounts of women to obtain nude images.
Former Northeastern track coach Steve Waithe hired Svara to hack women's accounts and has been sentenced to five years.
Svara targeted women nationwide and in Maine; he faces potential sentences of up to 20 years for wire fraud.

title: The Patriots’ Jack Gibbens went viral for his interview with a reporter born without legs. Dave Stevens’s story is deeper than that.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Dave Stevens, born without legs, went viral for an interview with Patriots' Jack Gibbens at Super Bowl LX.
Stevens is a seven-time Emmy winner, former ESPN producer, and advocates for people with disabilities.
Gibbens joined Stevens on the floor to facilitate the interview, emphasizing empathy and mutual respect.

title: Bad Bunny preaches unity, teases what to expect from Super Bowl LX halftime show
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bad Bunny will perform the Super Bowl LX Halftime Show in Santa Clara, marking the first primarily non-English performance.
He promises a fun and culturally rich performance, focusing on dance and enjoyment rather than language barriers.
NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell supports Bad Bunny's role in unifying audiences on a global platform.

title: GOP candidates weigh in on transgender athlete controversy raised on South Shore
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts GOP candidates support a Pembroke mother concerned about transgender athletes competing in girls' high school sports.
Chrissy Nelson argues that her daughter was disadvantaged in a track event due to a transgender competitor.
Republican candidates deem current policies unfair, while opponents urge consideration of transgender rights and existing MIAA rules.

title: Mayor Wu announces new efforts to restrict ICE in Boston
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu orders federal officials barred from using Boston city property for immigration enforcement.
Boston police directed to investigate potential crimes by federal agents violating city or state laws.
Executive order follows backlash against immigration enforcement tactics in Minnesota and Maine.

title: Sing your praises for Drake with our Maye-inspired crossword and playlist
author: Peter Chianca and Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston.com published a Drake Maye-inspired crossword and playlist for Patriots fans ahead of the Super Bowl.
The crossword includes song and album titles featuring the word 'may,' with a playlist available on Spotify.
The playlist is designed to energize fans for Super Bowl Sunday when the Patriots face the Seahawks.

title: Robert Spillane: Tom Brady’s neutral Super Bowl pick ‘makes me sick’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl, stating he has 'no dog in the fight'.
Ex-Patriot Vince Wilfork and current Patriot Robert Spillane criticized Brady's neutral stance on the Super Bowl.
Rob Gronkowski defended Brady but expressed clear support for the Patriots in the upcoming Super Bowl.

title: Lawsuit against Tesla reveals harrowing 911 call as driver trapped in burning car
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A lawsuit filed against Tesla claims a driver, Samuel Tremblett, died in a car fire due to inoperable electric door handles.
The suit details Tremblett's 911 call and notes first responders could not extinguish the fire or extract him from the vehicle.
Tesla's door handle design and lithium-ion battery fires are under scrutiny, with similar cases reported globally, including a ban in China.

title: The 6 most romantic places in New England, according to Travel + Leisure
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel + Leisure lists Boston Public Garden as Massachusetts' most romantic spot.
Isle au Haut in Maine offers secluded romance with ferry access and national parkland.
Vermont's Scenic Route 100 Byway features iconic fall foliage for a romantic drive.
